tv.amwa.maj.record

Interface Rational

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    RationalImpl

    public interface Rational

    Specifies a rational number by means of a Java integer numerator (Int32) and a Java integer (Int32) denominator.

    To make values of this type, use the following methods from the MAJ forge:

    • From its numerator and denominator: Forge.makeRational(int, int);
    • A zero default value: Forge.zeroRational();
    • From a string representation as generated by toString(): Forge.parseRational(String).
    See Also:
    TypeDefinitions.Rational

      • toString

        String toString()

        Formats a string representation of this rational value as the numerator, followed by a slash (/), followed by the denominator. For example, "1/4". The format is the same as that parsed by Forge.parseRational(String).

        Overrides:
        toString in class Object
        Returns:
        This rational value formatted as a string.
        See Also:
        Forge.parseRational(String)
